results.definition: restate (words) from one language into another language
examples: I have to translate when my in-laws from Austria visit the U.S.

results.definition: change from one form or medium into another

examples: the growth in income translates into greater purchasing power

results.definition: be translatable, or be translatable in a certain way
examples: Tolstoy's novels translate well into English

results.definition: bring to a certain spiritual state
change the position of (figures or bodies) in space without rotation
determine the amino-acid sequence of a protein during its synthesis by using information on the messenger RNA
express, as in simple and less technical language
examples: Can you translate the instructions in this manual for a layman?
Is there a need to translate the psychiatrist's remarks?

results.definition: subject to movement in which every part of the body moves parallel to and the same distance as every other point on the body
